subject: Re: [junit] Websphere Connection Pool
msgSnippet: So said  clairegknowles   on  2003-01-24 ... Hello, Claire. What are you trying to test? Do you want to test whether you can connect
messageBody:
So said clairegknowles <mail@...> on 2003-01-24
--------------------

>I am currently writing a web application which uses the Websphere
>connection pool. I can write tests for the rest of my applciation,
>how to I test connections to the db, and objects which use the db
>connections without having to run the websphere server?
>
>Thanks

Hello, Claire.

What are you trying to test?

Do you want to test whether you can connect to the database properly?
That can only be done by connecting to a live database. Any other way
to test that feature wouldn't test what you want to test.

Do you want to test whether connection pooling is enabled? There may be
no way to test directly for this, but rather to use the WebSphere
Resource Analyzer to check that the number of connections created and
reused is as expected. You would probably want to simulate some load on
your system OR you could write a simple app that asks for 1000
connections in 10 threads and see what happens.

Do you want to test whether you use the database correctly? If you're
testing your JDBC code, then simply assert that you are generating the
correct SQL statements and that you are cleaning up your result sets,
statements and connections, by using a mock connection, as others have
suggested.

Do you want to test something else? Tell us and we'll provide more
specific advice.

Good luck.
